profile.name: Safwan Hossain
profile.tagline: I like creating things - useful, fun, or sometimes just to see what happens :)

projects.title: Poker Game Server
projects.description: Real time Texas Hold’em multiplayer server with reactive WebSocket gameplay and cloud native architecture. Built with Spring Boot WebFlux and deployed to AWS Fargate.

projects.title: Spring Login Service
projects.description: Production ready Spring Boot login system with Azure deployment, GraalVM native builds, PostgreSQL integration, and email verification.

bullets: Developed scalable REST APIs and microservices for a financial services provider using Java, Spring Boot, and SQL, enhancing security and enabling seamless management of high-value transactions.
Reduced processing time by 32% for Javabased hospital invoice processing software through code refactoring and performance tuning.
Reduced memory usage by 17% by minimizing object creation, optimizing serialization techniques, and implementing more efficient data structures.
Converted a monolithic pawn shop enterprise application into microservices, improving scalability, resilience, and deployment efficiency.
Built and maintained strong relationships with property owners through regular check-ins, performance reviews, and clear communication, increasing long-term client retention.

Improved overall client satisfaction by 17% by engaging directly with property owners to understand challenges (e.g., delayed financial updates, difficulty navigating software) and implementing tailored solutions like automated reporting and UI walkthroughs.

Boosted operational efficiency by 66% by streamlining daily tasks and automating workflows, including management activities and financial reporting, leveraging tools such as Zapier, Lodgify, and PriceLabs.
Reduced load times by 14% by debugging and optimizing Angular code, improving front end performance.
Refactored legacy Java codebases to reduce technical debt and improve maintainability using modern design patterns.
Achieved over 90% line and branch coverage by writing unit tests using Java, Spring Boot, Maven, Jacoco, Mockito, JUnit, and SQL.
Followed Agile methodologies using tools like Jira and Rally for continuous integration and sprint planning.

bio.out: Software engineer exploring backend and full stack development
I make things that are helpful, or harmlessly chaotic
Hiking, side projects, and breaking things
